alert.note: Alert for Copper River Basin (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued May 30 at 2:18PM AKDT until May 31 at 12:00PM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 2 to 4 inches. * WHERE...Copper River Basin. Heaviest amounts from Glennallen to the north and northeast. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to noon AKDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An unseasonably late snowfall is expected in the Copper River Basin tonight into Wednesday morning. The current expectation is for 2 to 4 inches of snow from Glennallen north and northeast along the Richardson highway and Tok cutoff. Amounts up to 2 inches west of Glennallen along the Glen Highway and south of Glennallen along the Richardson Highway. Due to the temperatures being just cold enough for snow, snow accumulations could be either more than expected or stay mostly rain in some parts of the Copper River Basin.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
